hero.headline: The Dr. Matilda A. Evans Educational Foundation
hero.subhead: “Honoring the life and historic impact of Dr. Matilda A. Evans – The first native-born African American South Carolinian, male or female, to be licensed to practice medicine in the state of South Carolina” – through education, public history, and community programs.

heroQuote.headline: “The Brainiest Negro in South Carolina”
heroQuote.quote: “If Columbia physicians were asked to name the South Carolina negro who had been of most service to the colored race, his answer would undoubtedly be Dr. Evans of the Taylor Lane Hospital.”

featuredStory.title: A legacy rooted in Columbia, shared with the world
featuredStory.description: Dr. Evans’ work shaped healthcare and civic life. Our foundation preserves her story and advances educational pathways inspired by her example.
